document.title: @chronark/access
document.description: A minimal library for access control. It is designed to be used together with opaque access tokens by providing a simple interface to define roles with different access permissions and verifying requests to resources.

document.title: darc-incheon.com
document.description: As a freelance full-stack developer, I independently developed a 26-page website for DARC featuring volunteer forms, donations, scheduling, and an admin panel. Built with Next.js and MongoDB, and deployed on Vercel, the platform is fully responsive and optimized for SEO.

body.raw:
[![](/darc.png)](https://www.darc-incheon.com/)


### **Summary:**

The **Darc Incheon Website** was developed as a freelance project for the **Incheon Drug Addiction Rehabilitation Center (DARC)**, part of the **Darc Community**, a non-profit organization that supports individuals recovering from drug addiction. This project was undertaken entirely by me, from initial design to deployment, showcasing my ability to deliver a professional, fully functional platform tailored to the client’s needs.

#### **About the Darc Community**:
The **Darc Community** is dedicated to drug addiction rehabilitation, creating a safe and nurturing environment for individuals to rebuild their lives. The Incheon chapter focuses on education, therapy, and empowerment through group programs, workshops, and community events. This website plays a crucial role in advancing their mission by streamlining resource access and enhancing public awareness.

---

### **My Role**:
As a freelance developer, I was responsible for:
- **End-to-End Development**:
  - Designed and implemented the website from scratch, including frontend, backend, and database integration.
- **Feature Implementation**:
  - Developed critical functionalities such as volunteer forms, donation handling, and appointment scheduling.
- **Admin Panel**:
  - Built a secure admin interface with role-based access for managing multimedia and content updates.
- **SEO Optimization**:
  - Ensured the site ranks well on Google and Naver by optimizing metadata, generating sitemaps, and integrating social tags.
- **Deployment**:
  - Hosted the platform on **Vercel**, leveraging its seamless integration with Next.js for smooth performance and scalability.
- **Client Communication**:
  - Worked directly with the organization to gather requirements, provide progress updates, and ensure alignment with their goals.

---

### **Core Features**:
- **Volunteer Management**:
  - Allows users to submit applications with automated email notifications sent to administrators.
- **Donation System**:
  - Secure payment integration for accepting and tracking donations.
- **Appointment Scheduling**:
  - A backend-powered scheduler for event and consultation bookings.
- **Admin Panel**:
  - Secure login (using bcrypt encryption) for authorized personnel to manage videos, announcements, and text data.
- **Responsive Design**:
  - Ensures seamless usability across all devices, enhancing user engagement.
- **SEO Optimization**:
  - Tailored for Google and Naver to improve the site's visibility and reach.

---

### **Tech Stack**

#### **Frontend**:
- **Next.js** for server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG).
- **Traditional CSS** for responsive and user-friendly design.

#### **Backend**:
- **Next.js API Routes** for RESTful API development.
- **MongoDB** for storing and managing user and event data.

#### **Deployment**:
- Hosted on **Vercel**, enabling easy scaling and high availability.

#### **Additional Features**:
- **Authentication**:
  - Secure admin access using **bcrypt** encryption.
- **SEO Optimization**:
  - Includes dynamic metadata, sitemaps, and sharing tags.

---

### **Impact**:
This freelance project reflects my ability to independently design and deliver a high-impact web solution that:
- **Streamlines Operations**: Simplifies administrative tasks like volunteer and donation management.
- **Enhances Awareness**: Provides educational resources and promotes DARC’s mission.
- **Supports Recovery**: Offers a comprehensive platform for individuals seeking rehabilitation.

This project is a testament to my full-stack development expertise and my commitment to delivering value to clients in the non-profit sector.

document.title: devchanbin.com
document.description: The website you are currently looking at.

body.raw:
Like so many others, I just wanted a place to collect some projects I worked on. Maybe I'll add a blog, maybe I won't. I'm not sure yet.

I used the template provided on Next.js website, built with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Upstash, Contentlayer, by Cronark

document.title: planetfall.io
document.description: I'm building a SAAS providing global latency monitoring for your APIs and websites from edge locations around the world. Have you ever wondered how fast your API is in any part of the world? Planetfall allows you to find out and monitor it continuously.

body.raw:
[![](/planetfall.png)](https://planetfall.io)

Planetfall is a SaaS platform that provides global latency monitoring and synthetic monitoring for APIs. With over 60 regions to monitor from, customers can gain insights into the true performance of their API by checking latency from around the world. 
Planetfall offers custom timeouts, threshold notifications, and real-time alerts for potential performance issues. Additionally, customers can create custom status pages to share with their customers, which can display availability and latency for every region. Planetfall offers a free tier that includes 100k checks per month and scales as customers grow. Overall, Planetfall helps customers stay in control of their API's performance, improve communication with their customers, and build trust.

document.title: Likelion UCSD Beginner Project
document.description: Created the Likelion UCSD Beginner Project Website, teaching web technologies like React, Next.js, and MongoDB through a project-based curriculum and workshops.

body.raw:
[![](/likelion.png)](https://likelion-ucsd-beginner-project.vercel.app/en/lessons)

### **Summary**  
As Vice President of **Likelion UCSD**, I spearheaded the creation of the **Likelion UCSD Beginner Project Website**, designed to teach web development fundamentals through structured lessons and projects. This platform supports students in gaining hands-on experience with modern web technologies while serving as an educational hub.

#### **About Likelion UCSD**  
**Likelion UCSD** is a chapter of the international **Likelion** organization, which empowers students to transform their ideas into tangible digital products. At UCSD, the focus is on providing beginner-friendly web development education through collaborative projects and a strong support network. The organization aims to bridge the gap between students’ aspirations and technical capabilities by fostering a vibrant community of learners and builders.

#### **Key Contributions**  
- **Comprehensive Curriculum Development**: Designed a step-by-step curriculum that includes hands-on projects to teach core web development technologies such as **HTML**, **CSS**, **JavaScript**, **React**, **Next.js**, **GraphQL**, and **MongoDB**.  
- **Website Development**: Built the website as a platform to host lessons, showcase student projects, and provide educational resources.  
- **Project-Based Learning**: Developed project examples for students to apply their skills in building full-stack web applications.  
- **Team Leadership**: Recruited and led project teams, managing roles, resolving conflicts, and ensuring deadlines were met.  
- **Student Mentorship**: Delivered weekly workshops, mentoring beginners on technical challenges and best practices.  
- **Deployment & Maintenance**: Deployed the platform on **Vercel**, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and accessibility.

---

### **Tech Skills**  
- **Frontend Development**: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Next.js  
- **Backend Development**: GraphQL, MongoDB  
- **Educational Leadership**: Curriculum design, project-based learning, team mentorship  
- **Deployment & Hosting**: Vercel for seamless hosting and scaling  

This project reflects my ability to combine technical expertise and educational leadership to create an interactive and practical learning environment, empowering students to build web applications while supporting their academic growth.

document.title: StitchWitch - Generative AI Surgery Assistant
document.description: Build demo of a generative AI surgery assistant named StitchWitch that gives real time feedback and warnings during surgery.

body.raw:
![](/stitchwitch.jpg)
  ![](/stitchwitch2.jpg)

 <iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MbhcjZalbf4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


### **Description**  
StitchWitch is an AI-powered app designed to revolutionize surgical precision and patient safety by leveraging generative AI and computer vision. The platform provides real-time surgical analysis, error detection, and feedback to assist surgeons during operations, addressing critical challenges in over 400,000 annual procedures.

---

### **My Role**  
As the lead developer of StitchWitch, I was responsible for:  
- **AI Integration**: Applied prompt engineering to optimize three Google Gemini Pro AI agents for real-time surgical analysis:  
  1. **Observer-Agent**: Analyzed live video feeds and provided context in natural language.  
  2. **Procedure-Agent**: Maintained procedural history for surgical tracking.  
  3. **Alert-Agent**: Ensured adherence to medical protocols and alerted surgeons of potential risks.  
- **Computer Vision Implementation**: Integrated **OpenCV** to process live video streams and extract frames for real-time analysis.  
- **Full-Stack Development**: Built the application using the **Reflex** framework, enabling seamless integration of frontend and backend functionality.  
- **Pitching & Collaboration**: Pitched StitchWitch at **LA Hacks** to companies like Google, Intel, PSTC, and Fetch.ai, effectively communicating its potential impact in healthcare.

---

### **Features**  
- **Real-Time Analysis**: Live surgical monitoring to detect errors and provide immediate feedback.  
- **Multi-Agent AI System**: Utilized distinct AI agents for observing, documenting, and validating surgical procedures.  
- **Simulated Surgical Streams**: Tested the system using simulated surgical live streams due to hardware constraints.  

---

### **Development Highlights**  
- **Generative AI**: Leveraged Google Gemini Pro's multimodal capabilities to address complex medical challenges.  
- **Computer Vision**: Utilized OpenCV for efficient real-time video analysis.  
- **Full-Stack Framework**: Streamlined development with Reflex, allowing robust frontend and backend workflows using Python.  

---

### **Technologies**  
- **AI Framework**: Google Gemini Pro  
- **Computer Vision**: OpenCV  
- **Full-Stack Development**: Reflex Framework  
- **Programming Language**: Python  

---

### **Impact**  
- Enhanced surgical precision and significantly reduced the likelihood of errors in critical medical procedures.  
- Demonstrated the innovative use of AI in healthcare, combining real-time feedback with simulated surgical workflows.  
- Created a transformative solution designed to save lives and improve surgical outcomes globally.  

---

### **Future Plans**  
- Improve dataset collection for more accurate model fine-tuning.  
- Explore integration with smart glasses like Ray-Ban Meta for improved surgical usability.  
- Deploy StitchWitch globally to revolutionize surgical procedures and enhance patient safety.  

---

### **Learn More**  
- [StitchWitch on Devpost](https://devpost.com/software/stitchwitch)  
- [Project Demo Video](https://youtu.be/MbhcjZalbf4)  

This project showcases my ability to design and execute innovative AI-powered solutions in healthcare, demonstrating expertise in computer vision, generative AI, and full-stack development to deliver impactful results.

document.title: Recipe Rating Prediction & Personalization AI
document.description: Developed machine learning models to predict recipe ratings and classify user preferences using the extensive Food.com dataset.

body.raw:
### **Description**  
This project dives into the world of culinary AI by analyzing the extensive **Food.com** dataset containing 230K+ recipes and 1.1M+ user interactions. The primary goals were to predict recipe ratings based on textual and numerical data and to classify user preferences (ratings ≥ 4) with machine learning models. By bridging data science and AI, the project offers valuable insights into user behavior and personalized recommendations, creating potential applications for food platforms and recipe discovery.

---

### **My Role**  
As the lead developer of this project, I spearheaded the following:  

- **Machine Learning Pipeline**:  
  - Built a **rating prediction model** using **TF-IDF vectorization** of review text and Ridge regression to identify factors affecting user ratings.  
  - Developed a **Random Forest Classifier** for preference prediction, achieving a high F1 score of **0.96**, emphasizing user-specific features like ingredient alignment and average ratings.  

- **Data Engineering**:  
  - Preprocessed the **Food.com dataset**, transforming raw data into actionable features, such as ingredient vectors, user interaction histories, and review sentiments.  
  - Applied **Jaccard Similarity** for personalized recipe recommendations based on ingredient overlap.  

- **Feature Engineering**:  
  - Analyzed textual data (reviews, tags, and ingredients) and identified key terms influencing recipe ratings, such as “great” (positive) and “worst” (negative).  
  - Highlighted the impact of user-specific features like **average ratings** and **interaction history** on preference prediction.  

- **Visualization & Insights**:  
  - Created detailed visualizations, including correlation matrices and word clouds, to present actionable insights on rating trends and ingredient importance.  
  - Emphasized the limitations of numerical features, showcasing how textual data drives better predictions.  

---

### **Features**  

- **Rating Prediction**:  
  - Predicted recipe ratings from review text with an MSE of **1.2823** using Ridge regression.  
  - Discovered significant textual patterns, with words like “thank” and “delicious” correlating strongly with higher ratings.  

- **User Preference Classification**:  
  - Developed a Random Forest Classifier to predict whether a user would give a high rating (≥4).  
  - Integrated features like Jaccard similarity for ingredient alignment, average user ratings, and recipe interaction counts.  

- **Recommendation System**:  
  - Personalized recipe recommendations based on ingredient similarity, improving user engagement and discovery.  

---

### **Development Highlights**  

- **Text Mining & TF-IDF**: Extracted meaningful features from textual data, transforming them into vectors to uncover latent patterns in user reviews.  
- **Multi-Model Approach**: Combined regression and classification techniques to explore different facets of the dataset, from numeric ratings to binary preferences.  
- **Data Visualization**: Highlighted trends and insights through interactive plots, showcasing ingredient popularity, rating distributions, and textual correlations.  

---

### **Technologies**  

- **Programming Language**: Python  
- **Machine Learning Libraries**: Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy  
- **Visualization Tools**: Matplotlib, Seaborn  
- **Data Sources**: Food.com Dataset (Kaggle)  

---

### **Impact**  

- **Enhanced Personalization**: Provided insights into user behavior and personalized recipe recommendations.  
- **Practical Applications**: Demonstrated how textual and interaction data can predict user preferences and improve engagement for food platforms.  
- **Data-Driven Insights**: Validated the importance of review text and user-specific features, paving the way for more effective recommendation systems in the culinary domain.  

---

### **Future Plans**  

- Expand the analysis to include **sentiment analysis** for more nuanced rating predictions.  
- Integrate additional features, such as cuisine preferences and dietary needs, to improve recommendation diversity.  
- Deploy the models on a user-facing platform for real-world testing and validation.  

---

### **Learn More**  

- [Food.com Dataset on Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/shuyangli94/food-com-recipes-and-user-interactions)  
- [Explore the Project on GitHub](https://github.com/chanbinna/cse258-fa24)  

This project highlights my expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and feature extraction, demonstrating the ability to transform raw data into actionable insights and build models for real-world applications.
